commit_message:
parse_isotime filter to parse a date string.

This then allows the resulting date value to be piped
to one of the standard django date/time format filters

This is identical to oslo timeutils parse_isotime, but annotated with
@register.filter

Required for blueprint: heat-ui

Change-Id: Ibecca77d50bb5c0df59e07e9572069215229f60a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/75/29475/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import iso8601 @register.filter def parse_iso8601(string): return iso8601.parse_date(string)

subject: Fix Cisco Nexus plugin failures for vlan IDs 1006-4094
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-22 06:51:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4d9bd0432284647bda1cc9c7c8a053a33350e4ec', 'message': 'Fix Cisco Nexus plugin failures for vlan IDs 1006-4094

Fixes bug 1174593

VLAN IDs in the range 1006-4094 are considered to be in the extended
range by the Cisco Nexus 3K switch. As such, the 3K rejects any
state change configuration commands for VLANs in this range, including
"state active" and "no shutdown". The errors returned by the 3K for
these commands can be ignored, since the default states for these commands
are acceptable for the 3K.

For the 5K and 7K versions of the Nexus switch, on the other hand, the
"state active" and "no shutdown" commands are required for proper VLAN
configuration, regardless of VLAN ID.

This fix splits the configuration commands which are used to create a
VLAN on the Nexus switch into three separate configurations:
  - VLAN creation
  - state active
  - no shutdown
For the "state active" and "no shutdown" configurations, the Cisco Nexus
plugin will tolerate (ignore) errors involving invalid setting of state
for VLANs in the extended VLAN range. These specific errors can be
identified by looking for the appearance of certain signature strings
in the associated exception's representation string, i.e. "Can't modify
state for extended" or "Command is allowed on VLAN".

This approach will yield a very small hit in performance, but the solution
is much less error prone than requiring customers to configure the
Cisco plugin for 3K vs. 5K vs. 7K, or perhaps even specific software
versions of the 3K, in order to inform the Cisco plugin whether
VLAN state configuration commands should be used or not.

Change-Id: I1be4966ddc6f462bca38428c4f904f8c982f318f

range by the Cisco Nexus switch. As such, the switch rejects any
state change configuraion commands for VLANs in this range, including
"state active" and "no shutdown". This fix removes the "state active"
and "no shutdown" command lines from the config snippet used to
configure VLANs on the switches, regardless of VLAN ID. It is safe
to remove these commands for VLAN IDs which are not in the extended
range, since these are the default settings when VLANs are configured
on the switch, and the Cisco Nexus plugin never changes VLANs
into the suspended or shutdown states.

commit_message:
Fix Cisco Nexus plugin failures for vlan IDs 1006-4094

Fixes bug 1174593

VLAN IDs in the range 1006-4094 are considered to be in the extended
range by the Cisco Nexus 3K switch. As such, the 3K rejects any
state change configuration commands for VLANs in this range, including
"state active" and "no shutdown". The errors returned by the 3K for
these commands can be ignored, since the default states for these commands
are acceptable for the 3K.

For the 5K and 7K versions of the Nexus switch, on the other hand, the
"state active" and "no shutdown" commands are required for proper VLAN
configuration, regardless of VLAN ID.

This fix splits the configuration commands which are used to create a
VLAN on the Nexus switch into three separate configurations:
  - VLAN creation
  - state active
  - no shutdown
For the "state active" and "no shutdown" configurations, the Cisco Nexus
plugin will tolerate (ignore) errors involving invalid setting of state
for VLANs in the extended VLAN range. These specific errors can be
identified by looking for the appearance of certain signature strings
in the associated exception's message string, i.e. "Can't modify
state for extended" or "Command is allowed on VLAN".

This approach will yield a very small hit in performance, but the solution
is much less error prone than requiring customers to configure the
Cisco plugin for 3K vs. 5K vs. 7K, or perhaps even specific software
versions of the 3K, in order to inform the Cisco plugin whether
VLAN state configuration commands should be used or not.

Change-Id: I1be4966ddc6f462bca38428c4f904f8c982f318f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/93/27793/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support mount options for NFS/GlusterFS volumes

This patch adds support for mount options for NFS/GlusterFS volumes.

To set options, append them to the line for the volume in the
nfs_shares_config or glusterfs_shares_config file:
 192.168.175.166:/testvol -o backupvolfile-server=192.168.175.177
 host1:/testvol2 -o backupvolfile-server=host2,rw,other_option

These options are used when mounting from the cinder-volume
service and the nova-compute service.  (There is an associated
nova-compute patch to enable the same.)

This is a useful change for GlusterFS because the
backupvolfile-server option enables a mount to succeed even if
the first server specified is offline.

Change-Id: I13bb0a930d6a05e803ccb50e6dc5d4b2b412ac11

commit_message:
Added verification for libvirt availability in driver.

  Added check for libvirt connection availability in
  nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver.destroy method, which
  raises new LibvirtNotAvailableException.

  Also in nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager._delete_instance
  added except block for LibvirtNotAvailableException, where
  instance's status in setted to 'error'.

  If libvirt service is unavailable and user wants to terminate
  an instance the instance gets vm_status 'error' instead of
  infinite task_status 'deleting' and vm_status 'active'.

  Fixes LP bug #966087

Change-Id: I80ec5c68946deed60f2091ac6025028899f1f991
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/27551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

As instances are soft deleted, instance data may still be
    available in the database. This feature allows users to
    retrieve this data if it's available. As it is implemented
    as a policy, it can be restricted to only certain users/roles.

When enabled, a show call on a deleted instance will return
    what data is available instead of a 404 Not Found. If the
    soft deleted data is purged from the database, a 404 Not Found
    will be returned to the user.

When disabled, a show call on a deleted instance will maintain
    it's normal behavior, thus returning a 404 Not Found.

DocImpact

Implements bp show-deleted-instances

Change-Id: If9e1f2fe1d7d7691a13aaa0d7c45dc126bee64c7
"}]
commit_message:
Add policy to enable showing of deleted instances

As instances are soft deleted, instance data may still be
    available in the database. This feature allows users to
    retrieve this data if it's available. As it is implemented
    as a policy, it can be restricted to only certain users/roles.

When enabled, a show call on a deleted instance will return
    what data is available instead of a 404 Not Found. If the
    soft deleted data is purged from the database, a 404 Not Found
    will be returned to the user.

When disabled, a show call on a deleted instance will maintain
    it's normal behavior, thus returning a 404 Not Found.

DocImpact

Implements bp show-deleted-instances

Change-Id: If9e1f2fe1d7d7691a13aaa0d7c45dc126bee64c7

commit_message:
Added region affinity to proxy server

The proxy server now is made aware of its location by the configuration
setting "region" if this is not set changes dont affect the behaviour.
The affinity is useful for when two regions exist which have a high latency.
When the region is set to "2", the proxy pushes all nodes which are in the
region 2 to the top and are thus tried first.

Usecase:
Region 1: Asia
Region 2: Europe
Proxy in Europe

Default behaviour is that a random node is selected. Thus sometimes the
proxy selects the asian server. This causes latencies and not needed inter-
continental traffic.

Change-Id: I851b5dc12b9d7895635f5d53dd5b023737bded7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/11/28811/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.region = int(conf.get('region', 0)) If the region configuration is set the nodes are sorted so that the desired region is at the top. # If the configuration is unset we do not resort. if self.region != 0: def region_comparer(x, y): # If the region matches the configured region push it to the top. if x['region'] == self.region: return -1 else: return x['region'] < y['region'] nodes.sort(cmp=region_comparer)

commit_message:
DB md5-collide

Test against hash collide for Containers and Accounts
Store the account and container name in the extended attributes of
the DB file.

Also remove some redundent calls to os.path.exists()

Change-Id: I7c1dc7139ce8fa0c31a0c74951383a7432791af0
Fix: Bug #1158661

commit_message:
Hide db_file

This started as a small re-importation from the "big" LFS into the
DB broker level. Note that the existing GlusterFS UFO code does
not need this, because its initialize() is empty. So the checks
fail all over the place silently. However, when I wrote a "posix fs"
stub plugin, I had containers as directories and thus did not have
the "db_file". Also, I ran the tests which split the difference
between 204 and 201 being returned.

This version of the patch switches db_file to _db_file to illustrate
its "internal" nature. However, this seems like opening a whole
bunch of questions like what to do with db_type?

The .is_good() wrapper is simply called .exists() in a parallel
patch for MD5 deconflicting. We kept this as it seems a better fit.

This patch does NOT do anything about _get_xxxx_brocker(), because
it does not buy us much. If it were possible to get rid of it, then
it would be good, but as it is, GlusterFS relies on it to hook.
Therefore it seems pointless to attack it. The best we could do
is to make it an empty trampoline to the broker.

Change-Id: I34219248070d427b81834c60c7d4c054cfcc7f89

commit_message:
snapshot keep in saving status after instance deleted

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make Nova to update the glance image
status via python-glanceclient.

For this fix, I submited other two code reviews in Nova and
Glance project below.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26943/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236/

resolve bug 1143659
resolve bug 1064386

Change-Id: Ib31b89c954eddfe91ca73240af8926bda386e756

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.

in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'AGENT' references to 'agent'

Change-Id: Ie4f9957b4b33cea6ac22d5edbe3147c3f11f4443
"}]
commit_message:
Reference AGENT OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'AGENT' references to 'agent'

Change-Id: Ie4f9957b4b33cea6ac22d5edbe3147c3f11f4443
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/38/29738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.CONF.register_opts(a_cfg.ROOT_HELPER_OPTS, 'agent')

commit_message:
Adds iniset to lowercase 'agent' group in quantum conf files

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.

Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

In the process of switching option group names to lowercase in Quantum,
we've confronted a chicken egg problem where root_helper is defined in 'agent'
but devstack executes iniset root_helper on 'AGENT'.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29738/

To have the above patch merge, there are two options,
1) Have oslo.config be case insensitive to group names.
2) Add a iniset to 'agent' in devstack while keeping iniset on 'AGENT'
   until above patch merges.

Option 1) is not possible since oslo.config is fixed to v1.1.0 and cores
only wish to have backward compatibility on conf files and not on how we
reference the option group in the code.
Option 2) seems to be the only solution to have review 29738 pass while
keeping compatibility with other quantum patches for the time being.

Therefore this patch adds an iniset on 'agent' above each iniset on 'AGENT'

Change-Id: I233e1a4f61aafe6c6070165f88006f06b1ad5ad5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/61/29861/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE agent root_helper "$Q_RR_DOM0_COMMAND" # TODO(zyluo): Remove after review 29738 merges iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE agent domu_root_helper "$Q_RR_COMMAND" # TODO(zyluo): Remove after review 29738 merges

commit_message:
Add CLI vs config file priority test

Add a test to show the current behaviour of config files overriding
CLI values, even where the CLI value comes after the --config-file
argument.

Change-Id: Iaa6dcee49339c096278cc11945cc244a665e6a0a

commit_message:
Capitalize boolean values in config files

This patch allows the usage of Puppet boolean values and still
configure values with OpenStack boolean style: True/False.

Change-Id: I413060bc2ec0a8d795a240cc144e503efae41e49

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/07/27907/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.config import cfg def test_network_ha_scheduling_on_port_creation(self): cfg.CONF.set_override('dhcp_agents_per_network', 2) with self.subnet() as subnet: dhcp_agents = self._list_dhcp_agents_hosting_network( subnet['subnet']['network_id']) result0 = len(dhcp_agents['agents']) self._register_agent_states() with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner="compute:test:" + DHCP_HOSTA) as port: dhcp_agents = self._list_dhcp_agents_hosting_network( port['port']['network_id']) result1 = len(dhcp_agents['agents']) self.assertEqual(0, result0) self.assertEqual(2, result1) def test_network_ha_scheduling_on_port_creation_with_new_agent(self): cfg.CONF.set_override('dhcp_agents_per_network', 3) with self.subnet() as subnet: dhcp_agents = self._list_dhcp_agents_hosting_network( subnet['subnet']['network_id']) result0 = len(dhcp_agents['agents']) self._register_agent_states() with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner="compute:test:" + DHCP_HOSTA) as port: dhcp_agents = self._list_dhcp_agents_hosting_network( port['port']['network_id']) result1 = len(dhcp_agents['agents']) self._register_one_dhcp_agent() with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner="compute:test:" + DHCP_HOSTA) as port: dhcp_agents = self._list_dhcp_agents_hosting_network( port['port']['network_id']) result2 = len(dhcp_agents['agents']) self.assertEqual(0, result0) self.assertEqual(2, result1) self.assertEqual(3, result2)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary tags/attributes from our tests

Remove the following tags/attributes from our tests:
S3, EC2, slow, bug=lp912922, bug='lp1170718',
category='server-addresses', category='live-migration',
nagative, type='regression'

Now, we are left with:

Tag                   Total # of instances
--------------------  --------------------
'NO TAG'              192
gate                  62
negative              172
positive              110
smoke                 89
whitebox              2

Attribute             Total # of instances
--------------------  --------------------
type                  408

Change-Id: Idab48a7e1a53a3d64fb57ae3cd3975d665180aeb

commit_message:
Move tests into cinderclient package.

tests/__init__.py implies a package in the global namespace called
tests. That's not what these are - they're tests in the cinderclient
namespace.

Change-Id: I29c95bcd8747c3f5f21d5d900879c9b6b1c9a963

commit_message:
Display table actions BatchActions buttons in the correct locale

The table actions' verbose names were getting initialised too
early. The most noticeable effect was all the red buttons being
displayed in English no matter the locale.

Fixes bug #1126324

Change-Id: I8e21a1ec73f11129317249d103c081e90fa13a34

However, for a quicker test run you can skip the Selenium tests by using the ``--skip-selenium`` flag:: ./run_tests.sh --skip-selenium This isn't recommended, but can be a timesaver when you only need to run the code tests and not the frontend tests during development.

commit_message:
Reference OVS OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'OVS' references to 'ovs'

Change-Id: Id8697138d822e331a6776f847915c61b40f8dd6a

commit_message:
Rename iface -> port, and restructure node.

Rename "iface" to "port" in the DB models and exceptions.
Restructure the "node" table based on API discussion in review 29867.
Make some changes to the v1 api (still more to do).

Update unit tests based on the above changes.

Change-Id: If5e0ff856424255a5e1ebcb134d262c91845fa26

commit_message:
Specify database group instead of DEFAULT

At the request of Quantum folks, Let us switch from DEFAULT to
database for the database related options. This will help with
migration etc.

DocImpact

Fixes LP# 1171837

Change-Id: If602a6a7cc0f2a202632dd14574fea60dce4b589

commit_message:
Add test cases for default_config_files

It's pretty important we actually test the behaviour of falling back to
a default list of config files. Very surprising that we weren't alrady
testing this.

Change-Id: I903384247480946cc6aed38528695a4b89e717d2

This patch applies a reverse SNAT rule to allow instances that have an
assigned floating IP to communicate with other instances in the same
OpenStack deployment, security group rules permitting. The patch
allows members of the same private network to communicate with each
other using their floating-ips in a more consistent fashion. The rule
also addresses the situation where the target is on another private
network.

This will only work for interaction between two servers that both have
floating IPs assigned to them.

Specifically, this patch solves the problem where a target server
"sees" the private address of the client. By SNAT'ing to the client's
floating-IP, the "sees" the correct reply address and the reverse
route follows the same path that an actual external connection would
take. The SNAT ONLY occurs if a DNAT occurred before hand, allowing
communication on private networks using private IPs to remain fully
private and internal. The limitation is of course if a DNAT occurs for
other reasons, there may be issues.

Resolves bug 1178745

commit_message:
Reverse path SNAT for DNAT floating-ip.

This patch applies a reverse SNAT rule to allow instances that have an
assigned floating IP to communicate with other instances in the same
OpenStack deployment, security group rules permitting. The patch
allows members of the same private network to communicate with each
other using their floating-ips in a more consistent fashion. The rule
also addresses the situation where the target is on another private
network.

This will only work for interaction between two servers that both have
floating IPs assigned to them.

Specifically, this patch solves the problem where a target server
"sees" the private address of the client. By SNAT'ing to the client's
floating-IP, the "sees" the correct reply address and the reverse
route follows the same path that an actual external connection would
take. The SNAT ONLY occurs if a DNAT occurred before hand, allowing
communication on private networks using private IPs to remain fully
private and internal. The limitation is of course if a DNAT occurs for
other reasons, there may be issues.

Resolves bug 1178745

Change-Id: I55b7131cff5fd5a2ebf826945370d4d550e74136
(cherry picked from commit 314c419323ddd512babc4504ef8a4be1e04f2af7)

subject: Fix ValueError from handoff logging.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-14 20:11:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/29a4d119533efa08a466abbe16b97891b27a0dcc', 'message': "Fix ValueError from handoff logging.

If you have StatsD logging turned on, then the iterator returned by
Ring.get_part_nodes() will emit StatsD packets when it yields a
handoff node. If the emission of that packet blocks, then eventlet
will trampoline to another greenthread before returning from
next(). Now, if that other greenthread tries to call next() on that
iterator, it blows up with a ValueError.

You can see this happen sometimes in the proxy's make_requests method
if two of the primary nodes are down. Greenthread A goes into next()
to get a handoff node, but blocks on sending a StatsD packet, and so
eventlet trampolines to Greenthread B. Now, Greenthread B also calls
next() to get a handoff node, and dies with a ValueError.

This commit wraps up that iterator with a mutex to avoid this problem.

(Do note that to reproduce this, you must have StatsD logging enabled,
as that's the only thing in the node-iterator's code that might cause
a trampoline.)

Change-Id: I8fe13d7295c056a2cab9e084f5966078a49bdc13

trampolines to Greenthread B. Now, Greenthread B also calls next() to
get a handoff node, and dies with a ValueError.

This commit wraps up that iterator with a mutex to avoid this problem.

Bug 1180110
Change-Id: I8fe13d7295c056a2cab9e084f5966078a49bdc13

commit_message:
Fix ValueError from handoff logging.

If you have StatsD logging turned on, then the iterator returned by
Ring.get_part_nodes() will emit StatsD packets when it yields a
handoff node. That network IO may make eventlet trampoline to another
greenthread before returning from next(). Now, if that other
greenthread tries to call next() on that same iterator, it blows up
with a ValueError.

Any socket IO inside a generator's next() method can cause this. It's
easiest to reproduce with StatsD logging turned on, but logging to
syslog can trigger it too.

You can see this happen sometimes in the proxy's make_requests method
if two of the primary nodes are down. Greenthread A goes into next()
to get a handoff node, then sends a StatsD packet, and so eventlet
trampolines to Greenthread B. Now, Greenthread B also calls next() to
get a handoff node, and dies with a ValueError.

This commit wraps up concurrently-accessed iter_nodes() iterators in a
new thing called a GreenthreadSafeIterator that serializes access.

Bug 1180110
Change-Id: I8fe13d7295c056a2cab9e084f5966078a49bdc13

commit_message:
make sql_connection optional

This commit sets the default to the sql_connection
class parameter from the cinder class to false so that
it is optional.

The cinder class is intended to configure settings common
to all ciner roles and sql_connection is specific to the server
side roles. This commit makes it optional, so that nodes configured
only as volumes do not have to set sql_connections.

Change-Id: Id20dcc68779b2bb3bfb67fdc5b0862d0c86aa7b0

commit_message:
Use ugettext_lazy instead of ugettext.

We should use ugettext_lazy to let users in different languages
get correct translation.Though in views or similar places
we can use ugettext with no problems, we should make code
style consistent.

This also fix the issues that the django proxy objects appear on the
launching instance page instead of translated strings. Now the
translated quota strings are handled correctly.

commit_message:
Read-only default domain for LDAP (bug 1168726)

A proper fix to the above was also blocked by bug 1117356, so that's
fixed here as well (updates properly return the resulting entities).

Change-Id: I672b90e67545cc1fe65b05ef7f8af5b42ca6afc3

commit_message:
Adding tests for rebuild image checks

Create instance has tests arounds it's image-checks, this patch just ports
those tests over to the rebuild case.

Change-Id: Ibe982e478ec2c8b44e130c022c6d1d493d6d9674
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/29332/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_rebuild_with_too_little_ram(self): instance = jsonutils.to_primitive( self._create_fake_instance(params={'image_ref': '1'})) def fake_extract_instance_type(_inst): return dict(memory_mb=64, root_gb=1) self.stubs.Set(flavors, 'extract_instance_type', fake_extract_instance_type) self.fake_image['min_ram'] = 128 self.stubs.Set(fake_image._FakeImageService, 'show', self.fake_show) self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceTypeMemoryTooSmall, self.compute_api.rebuild, self.context, instance, self.fake_image['id'], 'new_password') # Reduce image memory requirements and make sure it works self.fake_image['min_ram'] = 64 self.compute_api.rebuild(self.context, instance, self.fake_image['id'], 'new_password') db.instance_destroy(self.context, instance['uuid']) def test_rebuild_with_too_little_disk(self): instance = jsonutils.to_primitive( self._create_fake_instance(params={'image_ref': '1'})) def fake_extract_instance_type(_inst): return dict(memory_mb=64, root_gb=1) self.stubs.Set(flavors, 'extract_instance_type', fake_extract_instance_type) self.fake_image['min_disk'] = 2 self.stubs.Set(fake_image._FakeImageService, 'show', self.fake_show) self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceTypeDiskTooSmall, self.compute_api.rebuild, self.context, instance, self.fake_image['id'], 'new_password') # Reduce image disk requirements and make sure it works self.fake_image['min_disk'] = 1 self.compute_api.rebuild(self.context, instance, self.fake_image['id'], 'new_password') db.instance_destroy(self.context, instance['uuid']) def test_rebuild_with_just_enough_ram_and_disk(self): instance = jsonutils.to_primitive( self._create_fake_instance(params={'image_ref': '1'})) def fake_extract_instance_type(_inst): return dict(memory_mb=64, root_gb=1) self.stubs.Set(flavors, 'extract_instance_type', fake_extract_instance_type) self.fake_image['min_ram'] = 64 self.fake_image['min_disk'] = 1 self.stubs.Set(fake_image._FakeImageService, 'show', self.fake_show) self.compute_api.rebuild(self.context, instance, self.fake_image['id'], 'new_password') db.instance_destroy(self.context, instance['uuid']) def test_rebuild_with_no_ram_and_disk_reqs(self): instance = jsonutils.to_primitive( self._create_fake_instance(params={'image_ref': '1'})) def fake_extract_instance_type(_inst): return dict(memory_mb=64, root_gb=1) self.stubs.Set(flavors, 'extract_instance_type', fake_extract_instance_type) self.stubs.Set(fake_image._FakeImageService, 'show', self.fake_show) self.compute_api.rebuild(self.context, instance, self.fake_image['id'], 'new_password') db.instance_destroy(self.context, instance['uuid'])

commit_message:
Add ImageNotActive check for instance rebuild

We have a check in place on create to test whether the image is marked
as deleted in Glance that doesn't exist on the rebuild method. This
patch adds that check and tests, with a follow-on patch forthcoming to
refactor the code to a shared method.

Fixes bug 1180604

Change-Id: I1e75313a72d2197e83f7dacf6bcbd6750dd490cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/29329/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.ImageNotActive as error: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=error.format_message())

commit_message:
Convert Nova to use Oslo service infrastructure.

Convert Nova to use the Oslo versions of:
* Service
* Launchers

Also add Service timers to the Service ThreadGroup.

blueprint use-oslo-services

Change-Id: Id8ab017f4525afd69fed322311f2d5cc3b6d6f98

commit_message:
Move recursive_keypairs into utils

Change-Id: I61ffe093cc4205ab306adc29c5e6c67c0247b276
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/12/29912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def recursive_keypairs(d): """Generator that produces sequence of keypairs for nested dictionaries. """ for name, value in sorted(d.iteritems()): if isinstance(value, dict): for subname, subvalue in recursive_keypairs(value): yield ('%s:%s' % (name, subname), subvalue) elif isinstance(value, (tuple, list)): # When doing a pair of JSON encode/decode operations to the tuple, # the tuple would become list. So we have to generate the value as # list here. yield name, list(map(lambda x: unicode(x).encode('utf-8'), value)) else: yield name, value

commit_message:
setup.cfg misses swift filter

The file misses the swift middleware filter
paste.filter_factory =
swift = ceilometer.objectstore.swift_middleware:filter_factory

commit_message:
only set network_vlan_ranges for vlan network types

This commit updates the quantum module to ensure
that vlan specific configuration is only applied
when the tenant_network_type is vlan or flat.

it also adds tests that were previously missing from
quantum_plugins_ovs_spec.rb.

Change-Id: I97cffff55ad6ff6cb683efc282e0db46d4687c1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/56/29856/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ($tenant_network_type == 'vlan') or ($tenant_network_type == 'flat') { quantum_plugin_ovs { 'OVS/network_vlan_ranges': value => $network_vlan_ranges; } } else { quantum_plugin_ovs { 'OVS/network_vlan_ranges': ensure => absent } }

commit_message:
Sync RPC serializer changes from Oslo

Pulls in the serializer object and changes to the dispatcher and
proxy implementations to support it.

Needed for bp/rpc-support-for-objects

Change-Id: I349de94c80a183f244cbb10009b6922996cc4d82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/29951/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common.rpc import serializer as rpc_serializer def __init__(self, callbacks, serializer=None): :param serializer: The Serializer object that will be used to deserialize arguments before the method call and to serialize the result after it returns. if serializer is None: serializer = rpc_serializer.NoOpSerializer() self.serializer = serializer def _deserialize_args(self, context, kwargs): """Helper method called to deserialize args before dispatch. This calls our serializer on each argument, returning a new set of args that have been deserialized. :param context: The request context :param kwargs: The arguments to be deserialized :returns: A new set of deserialized args """ new_kwargs = dict() for argname, arg in kwargs.iteritems(): new_kwargs[argname] = self.serializer.deserialize_entity(context, arg) return new_kwargs kwargs = self._deserialize_args(ctxt, kwargs) result = getattr(proxyobj, method)(ctxt, **kwargs) return self.serializer.serialize_entity(ctxt, result)

commit_message:
Add notification for live migration

Fix bug 1167759

Currently, if live migration failed, nova compute did not send
notification, this causes other services such as nova-scheduler
to have no chance to do some operations

The fix add notification logic for live_migration like other
VM instance operations such as resize, run instance etc.

Change-Id: Iaf61f5268e07284fd7d69ff331ce3bacd380c02b

subject: Add requests requirement capped <1.2.1.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-21 00:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pip-requires'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c39687edb9138c6eac675b8781a5d4bf5a51c968', 'message': "Add requests requirement capped <1.2.1.

Fixes bug 1182271.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work.
Because requests is actually a dependency of python-cinderclient but
is only breaking nova's unit tests, it has to be added and come
before python-cinderclient in the pip-requires list. A separate
change has been proposed to openstack/requirements which will need
to merge first. https://review.openstack.org/29850

Change-Id: Ia198192d6231f71272d3aa4f5942828a45d86ceb
"}]
commit_message:
Add requests requirement capped <1.2.1.

Fixes bug 1182271.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work.
Because requests is actually a dependency of python-cinderclient but
is only breaking nova's unit tests, it has to be added and come
before python-cinderclient in the pip-requires list. A separate
change has been proposed to openstack/requirements which will need
to merge first. https://review.openstack.org/29850

Change-Id: Ia198192d6231f71272d3aa4f5942828a45d86ceb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/29852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Minor changes to quantum::agents::ovs

This patch contains two minor edits to the
quantum::agents::ovs code.

1. allow setting of the firewall_driver.

This code ensures that the firewall driver can be
either set to its default of IptablesFirewallDriver
or unset (which we believe is required in the case
of compute nodes with gre enabled)

2. explicitly remove tunneling configuration when
it is not being used. This is part of an ongoing
attempt to clean up configuration that are not
currently in use.

This patch also adds tests to verify the proposed
code.

Change-Id: I372889d1c8821605d60c91c1e244d1a4c83fcc5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/55/29855/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :firewall_driver => 'quantum.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver', should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('SECURITYGROUP/firewall_driver').\ with_value(p[:firewall_driver]) should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('OVS/enable_tunneling').with_value(false) should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('OVS/tunnel_bridge').with_ensure('absent') should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('OVS/local_ip').with_ensure('absent') should_not contain_vs_brige(p[:integration_bridge]) context 'when supplying a firewall driver' do before :each do params.merge!(:firewall_driver => false) end it 'should configure firewall driver' do should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('SECURITYGROUP/firewall_driver').with_ensure('absent') end end context 'when enabling tunneling' do context 'without local ip address' do before :each do params.merge!(:enable_tunneling => true) end it 'should fail' do expect do subject end.to raise_error(Puppet::Error, /Local ip for ovs agent must be set when tunneling is enabled/) end end context 'with default params' do before :each do params.merge!(:enable_tunneling => true, :local_ip => '127.0.0.1' ) end it 'should configure ovs for tunneling' do should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('OVS/enable_tunneling').with_value(true) should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('OVS/tunnel_bridge').with_value(default_params[:tunnel_bridge]) should contain_quantum_plugin_ovs('OVS/local_ip').with_value('127.0.0.1') should contain_vs_bridge(default_params[:tunnel_bridge]).with( :ensure => 'present', :require => 'Service[quantum-plugin-ovs-service]' ) end end end end

subject: Cap requests <1.2.1.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-21 00:17:04.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pip-requires'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/c2b99a14a74e3e7073c0c2898b0fe94a66723ca9', 'message': "Cap requests <1.2.1.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work. A
corresponding patch is being drafted for nova, bug 1182271.

Change-Id: I2ea71d2bbc8a4e67a4c07672aadef218330641da
"}]
commit_message:
Cap requests <1.2.1.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work. A
corresponding patch is being drafted for nova, bug 1182271.

Change-Id: I2ea71d2bbc8a4e67a4c07672aadef218330641da

commit_message:
Pass memcache_servers as array

the python-memcached module expects memcache_servers to be an
array of strings or an array of tuples. Since we don't care about
server weighting, we can use an array of tuples for the unit test.

Fixes bug 1172723

Change-Id: Iafba2bda545ea334d5aba7135e153d8589612ba4

commit_message:
blueprint test-cascade-deletes

This test case ensures that objects related to a user or role are
deleted when the user or role is deleted.

As I was working on Bug 963348, I created these test cases to ensure
the deleted were being propogated in the database. The bug was
invalid, so I am submitting the test as a blueprint

Change-Id: I1ad22777f03077fe243c79cd6177cabbd15ef5ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/60/17360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 OpenStack LLC # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid import sys import sqlalchemy import sys from keystone import config from keystone import test from keystone import identity from keystone.common import sql from keystone.identity.backends.sql import UserTenantMembership from keystone.identity.backends.sql import UserProjectMetadata from keystone.identity.backends.sql import User from keystone.identity.controllers import RoleController CONF = config.CONF class CascadeDeleteTests(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(CascadeDeleteTests, self).setUp() self.config([test.etcdir('keystone.conf.sample'), test.testsdir('test_overrides.conf'), test.testsdir('backend_sql.conf')]) # create and share a single sqlalchemy engine for testing self.engine = sql.Base().get_engine(allow_global_engine=False) self.metadata = sqlalchemy.MetaData() # populate the engine with tables & fixtures self.metadata.bind = self.engine # define identity_api self.identity_man = identity.Manager() self.identity_api = self.identity_man.driver # define names self.role_name = 'admin' self.tenant_name = 'ProjectX' def tearDown(self): # Delete the tenant tenant = self.identity_api.get_tenant_by_name(self.tenant_name) self.identity_api.delete_tenant(tenant['id']) super(CascadeDeleteTests, self).tearDown() def check_table(self, table, table_key, user_id, expected): session = self.identity_api.get_session() query = session.query(table) query = query.filter(table_key == user_id) users = query.all() self.assertEquals(len(users), expected) def check_user_tenant_membership(self, user_id, expected): self.check_table(UserTenantMembership, UserTenantMembership.user_id, user_id, expected) self.check_table(UserProjectMetadata, UserProjectMetadata.user_id, user_id, expected) self.check_table(User, User.id, user_id, expected) def get_role_by_name(self, role_name): roles = self.identity_api.list_roles() for role in roles: if(role['name'] == role_name): return role['id'] def create_objects(self): # create the tenant self.tenant_id = uuid.uuid4().hex tenant = { 'id': self.tenant_id, 'name': self.tenant_name} try: self.identity_api.create_tenant(self.tenant_id, tenant) except: tenant = self.identity_api.get_tenant_by_name(tenant_name) self.tenant_id = tenant['id'] # create the user user_name = "FooX" self.user_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user = {'id': self.user_id, 'name': user_name, 'password': 'password'} try: self.identity_api.create_user(self.user_id, user) except: user = self.identity_api.get_user_by_name(user_name) self.user_id = user['id'] # add user to tenant self.identity_api.add_user_to_tenant(self.tenant_id, self.user_id) # create the role self.role_id = uuid.uuid4().hex role = {'id': self.role_id, 'name': self.role_name} try: self.identity_api.create_role(self.role_id, role) except: # retrieve the role self.role_id = self.get_role_by_name('admin') # associate user to a role try: self.identity_api.add_role_to_user_and_tenant(self.user_id, self.tenant_id, self.role_id) except: pass def xtest_delete_user_cascades_deletes(self): self.create_objects() # retrieve user_tenant_membership information self.check_user_tenant_membership(self.user_id, 1) # delete the user self.identity_api.delete_user(self.user_id) # ensures the record in the user_tenant_membership has been deleted self.check_user_tenant_membership(self.user_id, 0) def xtest_delete_role(self): self.create_objects() self.role_id = self.get_role_by_name(self.role_name) self.identity_api.delete_role(self.role_id) self.identity_api.get_roles_for_user_and_tenant(self.user_id, self.tenant_id)

commit_message:
Convert non-ascii characters within image property to unicode

Convert non-ascii characters within image property (key/value pair) to
unicode but utf-8 to prevent provisioning failure when cloud using qpid
backend.
This change also make the image property encoding consistency between
the image updating and the receiving. Before this, image property
updating use unicode, but receiving (get) result is utf-8.

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I010760c598a7e008c79f1240255708265352cdb5
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Documentation about the initial configuration file and sample data.

The initial configuration file and sample data are both are helpful in getting
setup with a keystone development environment.

Change-Id: Ic100177abe8dda1510a183463e61e0b757986e97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/45/26045/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Configuring Keystone -------------------- keystone requires a configuration file. There is a sample configuration file that can be used to get started:: $ cp etc/keystone.conf.sample etc/keystone.conf The defaults are enough to get you going, but you can make any changes if needed. :doc:`man/keystone-manage` which allows you to initialize keystone, etc.Initial Sample Data ------------------- There is an included script which is helpful in setting up some initial sample data for use with keystone:: $ SERVICE_TOKEN=ADMIN tools/with_venv.sh tools/sample_data.sh Notice it requires a service token read from an environment varialble for authentication. The default value "ADMIN" is from ``etc/keystone.conf``. Once run, you can see the sample data that has been created by using the `python-keystoneclient`_ command-line interface:: $ tools/with_venv.sh keystone --token ADMIN --endpoint http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/ user-list
deleted_lines: :doc:`man/keystone-manage` which allows you to establish tenants, users, etc.

commit_message:
Implement Token Flush via keystone-manage.

Creates a cli entry 'token_flush' which removes all expired tokens.

Fixes: bug 1032633
Implements: blueprint keystone-manage-token-flush
Change-Id: I47eab99b577ff9e9ee74fee08e18fd07c4af5aad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/33/28133/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone import tokenclass TokenFlush(BaseApp): """Flush expired tokens from the backend""" name = 'token_flush' @classmethod def add_argument_parser(cls, subparsers): parser = super(TokenFlush, cls).add_argument_parser(subparsers) parser.add_argument('--strategy') return parser @classmethod def main(cls): strategy = CONF.command.strategy if strategy is None or strategy == 'archive': allow_deletion = False elif strategy == 'delete': allow_deletion = True else: raise ValueError("Unknown strategy: '%s'. " "Valid strategies are [delete, archive]" % strategy) token_manager = token.Manager() token_manager.driver.flush_expired_tokens(allow_deletion) TokenFlush,

commit_message:
Add support for default --key values.

We are using a pattern of suppressing errors to allow missing keys
in some TripleO elements.

This allows simply specifying a default value inside
os-config-applier.

Change-Id: I15702d205bab995f918f2efcb75af832b760be74

commit_message:
Allow empty strings for raw and default types.

Empty string is a perfectly valid raw string and the default type is
meant to prevent malicious characters, not empty strings.

Change-Id: I717bbcfe1a81b383782122870d0d727b28f40cce

commit_message:
Building the image using dib no longer ignores the base element

When we build our image using dib, we should no longer use the -n flag which
suppresses the base element. With this fix, our first-boot.d script is now
being run on boot and the guest agent is installed successfully.

Fixes bug: 1182269

Change-Id: Ibdeb1f19b7b3e19e5709051251cdba1a99eda588

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ gettext for openstack-common modules. Usual usage in an openstack.common module: from novaclient.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ """ import gettext import os _localedir = os.environ.get('novaclient'.upper() + '_LOCALEDIR') _t = gettext.translation('novaclient', localedir=_localedir, fallback=True) def _(msg): return _t.ugettext(msg) def install(domain): """Install a _() function using the given translation domain. Given a translation domain, install a _() function using gettext's install() function. The main difference from gettext.install() is that we allow overriding the default localedir (e.g. /usr/share/locale) using a translation-domain-specific environment variable (e.g. NOVA_LOCALEDIR). """ gettext.install(domain, localedir=os.environ.get(domain.upper() + '_LOCALEDIR'), unicode=True)

commit_message:
Add update method of security group name and description

make it possible to edit the name and description of
common security groups, we can not rename the default
security group.

Fixes: bug #918393

Change-Id: I7003c47e054f032572adbb901be4dbc61839b695
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/34/29034/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_security_group(self, context, id, security_group): s = security_group['security_group'] with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): sg = self._get_security_group(context, id) if sg['name'] == 'default' and 'name' in s: raise ext_sg.SecurityGroupCannotUpdateDefault() sg.update(s) return self._make_security_group_dict(sg)

commit_message:
Avoid installing python-nose for RHEL6.

 * python-nose on RHEL isn't new enough to support Tempest.

Change-Id: I98107bf664a12f6252f74b4511e3228d511ff855
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/55/29355/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # RHEL6-packaged nose is too old for tempest if [[ is_fedora && $DISTRO =~ (rhel6) ]]; then pip_install nose --upgrade fi

commit_message:
Add generic serialization support

This adds a generic serialization model that the RpcProxy and
RpcDispatcher will use to serialize and deserialize arguments
and return values. The base definition is provided, as well
as a default NoOpSerializer which performs no special
action (retaining the existing behavior).

Related to blueprint rpc-object-serialization

Change-Id: I0a33baddee3e28dfc47100eb3216b679558b0bdd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/44/28744/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _serialize_msg_args(self, msg): """Helper method called to serialize the args inside a message. This calls arg.to_primitive() for any arg in msg that has such an implementation. :param msg: The message to send, with potentially non-primitive arguments :returns: The message with its 'args' serialize """ for argname, arg in msg['args'].items(): if hasattr(arg, 'to_primitive'): msg['args'][argname] = arg.to_primitive() def _deserialize_result(self, result): """Helper method called to deserialize the result of a call. This is a hook that is called to deserialize (if necessary) the result of a call. It is unimplemented here, but provided for subclasses to implement if necessary. :param result: The result of the call :returns: The deserialized (if necessary) result """ return result self._serialize_msg_args(msg) result = rpc.call(context, real_topic, msg, timeout) return self._deserialize_result(result) self._serialize_msg_args(msg) result = rpc.multicall(context, real_topic, msg, timeout) return self._deserialize_result(result) self._serialize_msg_args(msg) self._serialize_msg_args(msg) self._serialize_msg_args(msg) self._serialize_msg_args(msg)
deleted_lines: return rpc.call(context, real_topic, msg, timeout) return rpc.multicall(context, real_topic, msg, timeout)

subject: Pass quantum admin credentials when setting up client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-16 16:35:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/quantumv2/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_quantumv2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7cfaa28c32aa560be9abdb3750b1d51b227fa3a0', 'message': 'Pass quantum admin credentials when setting up client

This patch fixes a race condition where the user gets a token, uses it
to delete an instance, and immediately deletes the token before 
quantum can use it to clean up the network associated with the 
instance. Note that in this scenario the user is not waiting for the 
instance to be completely deleted before deleting the token that is 
passed to quantum.

Fixes bug 1177579

Change-Id: I3fe369402cbb0bc38ff3e528ba0eb0e7189cd66f

commit_message:
Pass quantum admin credentials when setting up client

This patch fixes a race condition where the user gets a token, uses it
to delete an instance, and immediately deletes the token before 
quantum can use it to clean up the network associated with the 
instance. Note that in this scenario the user is not waiting for the 
instance to be completely deleted before deleting the token that is 
passed to quantum.

Fixes bug 1177579

Change-Id: I3fe369402cbb0bc38ff3e528ba0eb0e7189cd66f

commit_message:
Allow suppression of v1 API.

Fixes bug 1180567

The v1 API is on the deprecation path, so should not require
that distros have all its dependencies available.

Thus we add a new configuration option to allow the v1 app
creation to be suppressed.

Change-Id: Ib5af241a57f54754be534c9acb92a377362571e3

commit_message:
Makes error message consistent with volume-attach

The patch for bug-1166770 hid the real exceptions raised by
check_attach. This patch fixes it so that more meaningful
exception messages can be given to the user and that they are
consistent with the volume-attach error messages

Change-Id: Ic5e93decffe8ccefe6d273033095a767b256f3cb
fixes: bug 1166770

commit_message:
Fallback to publicURL if adminURL is not found.

This change falls back on publicURL if the adminURL is not found in
the service catalog.  This change maintains the historic default
behavior of using 'adminURL' if it is there.

Also, adds a new exception type to handle the case where a suitable
endpoint type is not found in the catalog.  Without this, the
exception encountered is a KeyError that is not accurately reported to
the caller of the quantum command line.

Added unit tests for the url_for method of the Service Catalog which
trigger the problem with the previous code base and pass with this
proposed fix.

Fixes: Bug #1123383
Change-Id: If89fde3c80ad1858333395462ac9a6855618a499

deleted_lines: service_type='network', endpoint_type='adminURL'): """Fetch the admin URL from the Quantum service for attr='region', filter_value=self.region_name, endpoint_type='adminURL')

commit_message:
Choose publicURL from keystone catalog by default.

Previous behavior was to choose adminURL.

Change-Id: Id414a20e6f4e863d3fec982b5a1173afa5531d28
Fixes: Bug #1123383

commit_message:
Expand controller abbreviations in WSGI resources

Several properites were expanded in the interest of readability. When in
doubt, be a little more verbose; you'll spend a lot more time reading
code than writing it.

commit_message:
Update security_group_api param

The security_group_api value now should either be nova or quantum depending
if one is using nova security groups or quantum security groups. When set to
quantum all nova security group api requests are proxied to quantum.

Change-Id: Ib619ac3ce8face0cea59f9de145562bd6e8e1762
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/86/28386/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: security_group_api=nova or quantum (StrOpt) If using nova security groups set to nova. If set to quantum all nova security group api requests will be proxied to quantum to handle.
deleted_lines: security_group_api=nova.compute.api.SecurityGroupAPI (StrOpt) The full class name of the security API class

Simplify setup steps for setting up repositories and use new repository layout.

commit_message:
Clean up exception handling in the WSGI transport driver.

This patch localizes try...except blocks, DRYs construction of
certain HTTP exceptions, and modifies what types of exceptions
are thrown (in some cases), to be more precise.

I also factored out some input validation code that happened
to be mixed up with all the exception handling.

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: I1030308bed1ec55477b176bf022118d53b46b7ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/84/28984/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This logic assumes # the storage driver returned well-formed messages. if len(resp_msgs) != 0: for msg in resp_msgs: msg['href'] = _msg_uri_from_claim( req.path.rpartition('/')[0], msg['id'], cid) del msg['id'] resp.location = req.path + '/' + cid resp.body = helpers.to_json(resp_msgs) resp.status = falcon.HTTP_200 else: resp.status = falcon.HTTP_204 # Buffer claimed messages #TODO(kgriffs): Optimize along with serialization (see below) except storage_exceptions.DoesNotExist: description = _('Claim could not be queried.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPServiceUnavailable(description) # Read claim metadata (e.g., TTL) and raise appropriate # HTTP errors as needed. metadata = _load_metadata(req.stream) except storage_exceptions.DoesNotExist: description = _('Claim could not be updated.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPServiceUnavailable(description) description = _('Claim could not be deleted.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPServiceUnavailable(description) def _load_metadata(stream): """Reads and deserializes claim metadata from a stream.""" try: obj = helpers.read_json(stream) except helpers.MalformedJSON as ex: LOG.exception(ex) description = _('Body could not be parsed.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPBadRequestBody(description) except Exception as ex: # Error while reading from the network/server LOG.exception(ex) description = _('Request body could not be read.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPServiceUnavailable(description) try: ttl = obj['ttl'] except KeyError: description = _('Missing "ttl" field for claim.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPBadRequestBody(description) if not isinstance(ttl, int): description = _('The value of the "ttl" field must be an integer.') raise wsgi_exceptions.HTTPBadRequestBody(description) return {'ttl': ttl}

commit_message:
rename tests -> api

Now that all the other tests are moved out of the tests directory
we can rename tests -> api to reflect that these tests are api
testing, and need to use only the internal clients.

Clean up references from other parts of OpenStack to the new api
namespace.

Reorder the imports as required with this naming change.

Added README.rst

Change-Id: I19203957f917b59e7c8a3838c590937752461a2f

commit_message:
tests : add explicit dependency on cinderclient 1.0.4

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28054/ introduces a test requirement
for the latest python-cinderclient, attempting to run with 1.0.3 results
in test_volume failing.  In due course we should probably fix test_volume
so it actually fakes the client instead of having this dependency

Change-Id: If9a649c7ce98125076e74243b17d115ca10acd01

commit_message:
Run the dnspython dependency back.

The initial dnspython dependency was probably a bit aggressive.  Ubuntu
Oneiric and Precise both packaged 1.9.4 and there's not too much in the
package changelog to recommend 1.10.0 over 1.9.4, at least not for a
requirement.

Change-Id: I8e2a03e4a89ee0f36c860cdaf21a7a0fea1709ca

subject: Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-29 18:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_floating_ips.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/726ae59b82d94e5f81e2512991776c001f22daa0', 'message': 'Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870
(cherry picked from commit a5923541e990326a9b850926e74026d5947ae142)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870
(cherry picked from commit a5923541e990326a9b850926e74026d5947ae142)

subject: xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-02 19:06:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/host.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/498ce526c1c2ce1ad1e17af9fc4a3ff67b0b09a4', 'message': "xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception

The existing code would catch a missing SR exception and bail out of the
`update_status` method before finishing, causing required keys to be missing.
The end-result was code breaking later on when it tried to access these keys.

Since an SR is required to generate these required stats keys, we shouldn't
swallow the StorageRepositoryNotFound exception and instead should fail-fast.

Fixes bug 1175357

Change-Id: I3d65ae807fb2d86277bc0061c1967a87792b6662
(cherry picked from commit b6aac988e46147154d49e938ecf9b67831613636)
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception

The existing code would catch a missing SR exception and bail out of the
`update_status` method before finishing, causing required keys to be missing.
The end-result was code breaking later on when it tried to access these keys.

Since an SR is required to generate these required stats keys, we shouldn't
swallow the StorageRepositoryNotFound exception and instead should fail-fast.

Fixes bug 1175357

Change-Id: I3d65ae807fb2d86277bc0061c1967a87792b6662
(cherry picked from commit b6aac988e46147154d49e938ecf9b67831613636)

commit_message:
Add setup.sh to project murano-api

Change-Id: Iabf12ffa3c9235a00b76effc886f0b1330f9b2bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/93/29893/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh # Install script for murano-api daemon # writen by Igor Yozhikov, provides as-is. LOGLVL=1 SERVICE_CONTENT_DIRECTORY=`cd $(dirname "$0") && pwd` PREREQ_PKGS="wget git python-pip python-dev python-mysqldb" SERVICE_SRV_NAME="murano-api" GIT_CLONE_DIR=`echo $SERVICE_CONTENT_DIRECTORY | sed -e "s/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME//"` ETC_CFG_DIR="/etc/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME" SERVICE_CONFIG_FILE_PATH="$ETC_CFG_DIR/murano-api.conf" if [ -z "$SERVICE_EXEC_PATH" ];then SERVICE_EXEC_PATH="/usr/local/bin/murano-api" fi # Functions # Loger function log() { MSG=$1 if [ $LOGLVL -gt 0 ]; then echo "LOG:> $MSG" fi } # Check or install package in_sys_pkg() { PKG=$1 dpkg -s $PKG > /dev/null 2>&1 if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then log "Package \"$PKG\" already installed" else log "Installing \"$PKG\"..." apt-get install $PKG --yes > /dev/null 2>&1 if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "installation fails, exiting!!!" exit fi fi } # git clone gitclone() { FROM=$1 CLONEROOT=$2 log "Cloning from \"$FROM\" repo to \"$CLONEROOT\"" cd $CLONEROOT && git clone $FROM > /dev/null 2>&1 if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "cloning from \"$FROM\" fails, exiting!!!" exit fi } # install inst() { CLONE_FROM_GIT=$1 # Checking packages for PKG in $PREREQ_PKGS do in_sys_pkg $PKG done # If clone from git set if [ ! -z $CLONE_FROM_GIT ]; then # Preparing clone root directory if [ ! -d $GIT_CLONE_DIR ];then log "Creting $GIT_CLONE_DIR direcory..." mkdir -p $GIT_CLONE_DIR if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "Can't create $GIT_CLONE_DIR, exiting!!!" exit fi fi # Cloning from GIT GIT_WEBPATH_PRFX="https://github.com/stackforge/" gitclone "$GIT_WEBPATH_PRFX$SERVICE_SRV_NAME.git" $GIT_CLONE_DIR # End clone from git section fi # Setupping... log "Running setup.py" MRN_CND_SPY=$GIT_CLONE_DIR/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME/setup.py log $MRN_CND_SPY if [ -e $MRN_CND_SPY ];then chmod +x $MRN_CND_SPY log "$MRN_CND_SPY output:_____________________________________________________________" cd $GIT_CLONE_DIR/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME && $MRN_CND_SPY install if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "Install of \"$MRN_CND_SPY\" FAILS, exiting!!!" exit fi else log "$MRN_CND_SPY not found!" fi # Creating etc directory for config files if [ ! -d $ETC_CFG_DIR ];then log "Creting $ETC_CFG_DIR direcory..." mkdir -p $ETC_CFG_DIR if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "Can't create $ETC_CFG_DIR, exiting!!!" exit fi fi # making smaple configs log "Making sample configuration files at \"$ETC_CFG_DIR\"" for file in `ls $GIT_CLONE_DIR/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME/etc` do cp -f "$GIT_CLONE_DIR/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME/etc/$file" "$ETC_CFG_DIR/$file.sample" done } # inject init injectinit() { ln -s /lib/init/upstart-job /etc/init.d/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME echo "description \"Murano Conductor service\" author \"Igor Yozhikov <iyozhikov@mirantis.com>\" start on runlevel [2345] stop on runlevel [!2345] respawn env PYTHONPATH=\$PYTHONPATH:/home/stack/murano-api export PYTHONPATH exec start-stop-daemon --start --chuid root --user root --name $SERVICE_SRV_NAME --exec $SERVICE_EXEC_PATH -- --config-file=$SERVICE_CONFIG_FILE_PATH" > "/etc/init/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME.conf" log "Reloading initctl" initctl reload-configuration update-rc.d $SERVICE_SRV_NAME defaults } # purge init purgeinit() { update-rc.d -f $SERVICE_SRV_NAME remove rm -f /etc/init.d/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME rm -f /etc/init/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME.conf log "Reloading initctl" initctl reload-configuration } # uninstall uninst() { rm -f $SERVICE_EXEC_PATH rm -rf $SERVICE_CONTENT_DIRECTORY } # postinstall postinst() { log "Please, make proper configugation,located at \"$ETC_CFG_DIR\", before starting the \"$SERVICE_SRV_NAME\" daemon!" } # Command line args' COMMAND="$1" case $COMMAND in inject-init ) # searching for daemon PATH if [ ! -x $SERVICE_EXEC_PATH ];then log "Can't find \"conductor\" in at \"$SERVICE_EXEC_PATH\", please install the \"$SERVICE_SRV_NAME\" or set variable SERVICE_EXEC_PATH=/path/to/daemon before running setup script, exiting!!!" exit fi ln -s /lib/init/upstart-job /etc/init.d/$SERVICE_SRV_NAME log "Injecting \"$SERVICE_SRV_NAME\" to init..." injectinit postinst ;; install ) inst injectinit postinst ;; installfromgit ) inst "yes" injectinit postinst ;; purge-init ) log "Purging \"$SERVICE_SRV_NAME\" from init..." stop $SERVICE_SRV_NAME purgeinit ;; uninstall ) log "Uninstalling \"$SERVICE_SRV_NAME\" from system..." stop $SERVICE_SRV_NAME purgeinit uninst ;; * ) echo "Usage: $(basename "$0") install | installfromgit | uninstall | inject-init | purge-init" exit 1 ;; esac

commit_message:
Replace nose with testr

- add .testr.conf (in base dir and nova_tests)
- remove all references to nose
- adjust paths: A couple of tests would assume the current directory
  was ./tests/ but it is now ./
- don't run the tests in parallel as the db tests have one connection
  per test class.

nova_tests hackery:
It seems testtools/testr imports everything and I just don't see a way of
running things in tests/ and nova_tests/ seperately but in one .test.conf.
So if you want to use testr directly you will need to:
 testr run
 cd nova_tests
 testr run

commit_message:
Use fixtures in the tests

TempDir() makes sure all files created under it are deleted
at the end of the tests.
FakeLogger() hides logs when the test passes and displays logs
for failed tests.

commit_message:
Fix cinder always converts raw images even if they are already raw

During the creation process of the command "cinder create --image-id"
cinder tries to convert the image no matter what the orign format is.
Thus the process can be speed up by simply checking if the image already
has the good format, if so we don't run the qemu-img command.

Change-Id: Ie683735c3dede9944bd5d41c729596b04b72c17d
Fixes: bug #1180831

commit_message:
Implement OS::Cinder::VolumeAttachment

This creates a new volume attachment resource with Cinder specific
naming.

Change-Id: Ie73b929925c58e47f3509d57dd385cbd4ea5a4c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/61/28961/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_cinder_attachment(self): fv = FakeVolume('creating', 'available') fva = FakeVolume('attaching', 'in-use') stack_name = 'test_volume_attach_stack' # volume create clients.OpenStackClients.cinder().MultipleTimes().AndReturn( self.cinder_fc) self.cinder_fc.volumes.create( size=u'1', availability_zone='nova', display_description='%s.DataVolume' % stack_name, display_name='%s.DataVolume' % stack_name).AndReturn(fv) # create script clients.OpenStackClients.nova().MultipleTimes().AndReturn(self.fc) eventlet.sleep(1).MultipleTimes().AndReturn(None) self.fc.volumes.create_server_volume( device=u'/dev/vdc', server_id=u'WikiDatabase', volume_id=u'vol-123').AndReturn(fva) self.cinder_fc.volumes.get('vol-123').AndReturn(fva) # delete script fva = FakeVolume('in-use', 'available') self.fc.volumes.delete_server_volume('WikiDatabase', 'vol-123').AndReturn(None) self.cinder_fc.volumes.get('vol-123').AndReturn(fva) self.m.ReplayAll() t = template_format.parse(volume_template) t['Resources']['DataVolume']['Properties']['AvailabilityZone'] = 'nova' t['Resources']['MountPoint']['Properties'] = { 'instance_uuid': {'Ref': 'WikiDatabase'}, 'volume_id': {'Ref': 'DataVolume'}, 'mountpoint': '/dev/vdc' } stack = parse_stack(t, stack_name=stack_name) scheduler.TaskRunner(stack['DataVolume'].create)() self.assertEqual(fv.status, 'available') resource = vol.CinderVolumeAttachment('MountPoint', t['Resources']['MountPoint'], stack) self.assertEqual(resource.validate(), None) scheduler.TaskRunner(resource.create)() self.assertEqual(resource.state, vol.VolumeAttachment.CREATE_COMPLETE) self.assertEqual(resource.handle_update({}), vol.Volume.UPDATE_REPLACE) self.assertEqual(resource.delete(), None) self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
update proposed API to be more resource oriented

/node/<id> is really the resource, so the id should change in
location, and not be at the end of the resource

Change-Id: I59853b33017b7eb59f053b985531ef4ea281bc79

commit_message:
engine : cleanup Resource.update error paths

The current update code uses a nasty pattern where returning an
arbitrary string from Resource.update is interpreted in parser.Stack
as an error.  Instead use exceptions which is much nicer :)

Change-Id: I2ddebfd6bbec3dc229012406da72dd928fcc4595

commit_message:
Reference DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE' references to
'default_servicetype'

Change-Id: Iccab055c4664e11c9618706e594416194065048b

commit_message:
Reference QUOTA OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'QUOTA' references to 'quota'

Change-Id: I74c2a35aea7a52f9586eb598fe52d2cecb1851ef

commit_message:
Make logging level in unit tests configurable.

Added a debug option to unittest(BaseTestCase) which sets logging level of
fixtures.FakeLogger to DEBUG. To enable this option, set OS_DEBUG=True or
OS_DEBUG=1 in environment variables.

Fixes: bug #1181925
Change-Id: Id09008ddabb837290edf12e1cbd014dc74760113

commit_message:
Allow RPC_API_NAMESPACE on RpcProxy objects

This allows one to subclass RpcProxy for use with a particular
namespace without having to repeatedly pass the namespace into the
make_namespaced_msg() method.  This new RPC_API_NAMESPACE attribute will
be used for the make_msg() call.  It is defaulted to None to match previous
behavior.

Change-Id: Ied62df839cda0be6f9f9b060bbfc22e086f61be8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/39/29839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The default namespace, which can be overriden in a subclass. RPC_API_NAMESPACE = None def make_msg(self, method, **kwargs): return self.make_namespaced_msg(method, self.RPC_API_NAMESPACE, **kwargs)
